instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Originally it gave 3 beeps on start up, so reflowed ram chips and it started working, but now when i connect genuine magsafe it doesn't charge or there's no green light, but if i connect aftermarket magsafe, there is green/amber light but battery doesn't charge.
Can anyone tell what could be wrong with it? And what's the ideal resistance between pin 17/18 and pin 28/27?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Seems that you have some leakage on input circuit.
Original charger detects that and doesn't power up the board.
It has a processor for this job.
Fake chinese charger doesn't have such processor and will always have full voltage output.
Original MagSafe2 charger has only 3V output first, at low current.

This issue is usually caused by <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.
Check <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86 values onboard.
Also check if <DIODE>D7010</DIODE> is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
It was bad dc in board, now green light comes and computer runs on battery but it doesn't charge(it charges but doesn't show charging sign, but i can see percentage going up).
one thing i noticed is that it charges with charging sign in recovery mode, but doesn't show charging sign in normal mode.
resistance between pin 17/18 is around 3 ohms and between pin 27/28 is 20ish ohms.
checked smbus resistors and they are fine and gets 3.3 volts on them.
acok is present, charger reset is present.
upon further inspection i found that pin 19 and 20 was getting 2.3 volts instead of 5, it was short on pin 20, so i replaced it and it went back to 5 volts but battery still doesn't charge.

is it possible that this short may have destroyed battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
I recommend you to test other battery first.
You can waste time digging in the MLB having bad battery.
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
What tells OSX about battery in System Report?
Does the machine start on battery only, without charger connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 41425"]I recommend you to test other battery first.
You can waste time digging in the MLB having bad battery.
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
What tells OSX about battery in System Report?
Does the machine start on battery only, without charger connected?[/QUOTE]

there are no voltages on amon and bmon, and is there suppose to be any voltage on pin 1 and 26? i don't get anything there.
it starts from battery only

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Pins 1 & 26 should be 0V, is correct.
Pins 9 & 15 should have some voltage, less than 1V; post the exact values!

Please, do NOT quote an entire post from 5cm above...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
It was ssd, used different ssd and it started charging.
thanks for the help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Okay, so back to square one, it started giving 3 beeps on start up again.
i have already reflowed ram chips, so is there anything else that i can do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
I recommend a good ultrasonic clean...
I hope used quality flux for RAM reflow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 41495"] I hope used quality flux for RAM reflow.[/QUOTE]

Yes i used good flux, it works for 2-3 days and then it starts beeping again. I am planning to replace ram chips.
can i use ram chips from any donor board or do i need exact same board for ram transplant? And where can i buy stencils for reballing? I don't know what type of stencils are used for reballing these chips

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Reballing RAM chips should be good enough.
Your problem should be generated by crap/corrosion under chips, not internal issues...

You can use any compatible chips, in case still want to change them.
